--- marp: true theme: default paginate: true backgroundColor: #fafafa header: "Solar Energy System Design & Installation Training" footer: "BEIT Project - Mosul, Iraq" style: | section { font-size: 30px; } h1 { color: #1e88e5; } h2 { color: #26a69a; } img.mermaid-diagram { display: block; margin: 0 auto; border-radius: 5px; box-shadow: 0 4px 8px rgba(0,0,0,0.1); background-color: white; padding: 10px; } .chart-container { display: flex; justify-content: center; align-items: center; height: 70%; } --- # Solar Energy System Design & Installation Training ## Introduction & Days 1-3: Core Fundamentals ![bg right:40% 80%](https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1597045315639-9df6c171e73b?ixlib=rb-1.2.1&auto=format&fit=crop&w=1352&q=80) --- # Training Overview ## Six-Day Comprehensive Program ```mermaid timeline title Training Program Schedule section Week 1 Day 1: Site Assessment & Load Analysis : Fundamentals Day 2: System Sizing & Financial Analysis : Design Day 3: Component Selection & Safety : Selection section Week 2 Day 4: Installation & Safety Protocols : Installation Day 5: Commissioning & Maintenance : Operations Day 6: Business Models & Capstone Project : Business ``` --- # Trainer Introduction - Name and background - Experience in solar industry - Contact information - Local projects completed in Mosul ![bg right:40% 90%](https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1581094794329-c8112a89af12?ixlib=rb-1.2.1&auto=format&fit=crop&w=1350&q=80) --- # Trainee Introductions Please share: - Your name - Your background/experience - Why you're interested in solar - What you hope to learn ![bg right:40% 80%](https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1529448005898-b19fc13465b7?ixlib=rb-1.2.1&auto=format&fit=crop&w=1350&q=80) --- # Training Ground Rules - Safety is always the top priority - Phones on silent but available for apps - Questions encouraged anytime - Respect all participants - Attendance required for certification - Everyone must participate in hands-on work ![bg right:30% 80%](https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1555963966-b7ae5404b6ed?ixlib=rb-1.2.1&auto=format&fit=crop&w=1350&q=80) --- # Teaching Approach ```mermaid mindmap root((Learning Approach)) Practical Focus "70% hands-on" "30% theory" Interactive Methods "Daily reviews" "Group rotations" "Peer teaching" Real-World Application "Local case studies" "Actual components" "Site visits" ``` --- # DAY 1: SITE ASSESSMENT & LOAD ANALYSIS ![bg](https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1611365892117-bdd4d0dactbd?ixlib=rb-1.2.1&auto=format&fit=crop&w=1352&q=80) --- # Iraq's Solar Opportunity ```mermaid quadrantChart title Mosul's Energy Situation x-axis Lower Cost → Higher Cost y-axis Less Reliable → More Reliable quadrant-1 High Cost, High Reliability quadrant-2 Low Cost, High Reliability quadrant-3 Low Cost, Low Reliability quadrant-4 High Cost, Low Reliability Solar Systems[0.7, 0.9] National Grid[0.2, 0.3] Diesel Generators[0.9, 0.6] ``` --- # Solar Market in Mosul ```mermaid pie title "Current Power Sources in Mosul Homes" "National Grid" : 45 "Diesel Generators" : 50 "Solar Systems" : 5 ``` - Market is in early growth stage (~5% penetration) - High reliance on neighborhood generators - Primary customer concern: reliability over cost - Most systems are hybrid (grid + battery backup) - Typical system size: 1-3 kW for residential --- # Solar Basics: PV System Overview ```mermaid flowchart TD A[Sunlight] -->|Photovoltaic Effect| B[DC Electricity] B --> C[Charge Controller] C --> D[Battery Storage] C --> E[DC to AC Inverter] D --> E E --> F[AC Appliances] style A fill:#ffeb3b,stroke:#f57f17 style B fill:#bbdefb,stroke:#1976d2 style C fill:#c8e6c9,stroke:#388e3c style D fill:#e1bee7,stroke:#8e24aa style E fill:#ffcdd2,stroke:#d32f2f style F fill:#ffe0b2,stroke:#f57c00 ``` --- # Types of Solar PV Systems ```mermaid classDiagram class "Solar PV Systems" { +Types } class "Grid-tied" { +No batteries +Grid backup +Exports excess } class "Off-grid" { +Battery storage +No grid connection +Generator backup } class "Hybrid (Most Common in Mosul)" { +Grid connection +Battery backup +Flexible operation } "Solar PV Systems" <|-- "Grid-tied" "Solar PV Systems" <|-- "Off-grid" "Solar PV Systems" <|-- "Hybrid (Most Common in Mosul)" ``` --- # Site Assessment Process ```mermaid mindmap root((Site Assessment)) Physical Roof Structure Available Area Orientation & Tilt Electrical Existing Panel Grounding System Wiring Capacity Environmental Shading Analysis Dust/Wind Patterns Temperature Extremes Documentation Photography Measurements Client Requirements ``` --- # Load Calculation Workshop ## Measuring in Amperes (Local Context) - Mosul customers understand amps better than watts - Generator service sold by amp rating (e.g., 10 amp service) - Formula: Watts ÷ Volts = Amps (at 220V) - Example: 1,100W coffee machine ÷ 220V = 5 amps - Include 20-30% safety factor in all calculations --- # Day 1 Hands-On Activities 1. Home Energy Audit Exercise - Calculate loads in amps - Measure actual consumption with power meters - Convert to daily kWh for system sizing 2. Site Assessment Practice - Roof evaluation techniques - Shading analysis with tools - Google Earth for site analysis --- # DAY 2: SYSTEM COMPONENTS & WIRING ![bg](https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1521618755572-156ae0cdd74d?ixlib=rb-1.2.1&auto=format&fit=crop&w=1350&q=80) --- # Inverter Technology Overview ## The Heart of Your Solar System ```mermaid mindmap root((Inverter Selection)) Specifications Input Voltage Range Output Power Rating Surge Capacity Efficiency Rating System Type String Inverter Hybrid Inverter Off-Grid Inverter Environmental Heat Tolerance Dust Protection Warranty Coverage Cost Factors Initial Price Lifespan Efficiency Losses ``` --- # DC vs. AC Electrical Principles ```mermaid classDiagram class "DC Characteristics" { +Continuous flow direction +No zero-crossing +Sustained arcs +Special breakers required +Thicker cable insulation } class "AC Characteristics" { +Alternating flow direction +Regular zero-crossing +Self-extinguishing arcs +Standard breakers +Standard insulation } ``` --- # Battery Types Comparison ```mermaid quadrantChart title Battery Comparison for Mosul x-axis Lower Cost → Higher Cost y-axis Shorter Life → Longer Life quadrant-1 High Cost, Low Performance quadrant-2 High Cost, High Performance quadrant-3 Low Cost, Low Performance quadrant-4 Low Cost, High Performance "Lead-Acid"[0.3, 0.2] "AGM"[0.5, 0.4] "Lithium-Ion"[0.9, 0.9] "Refurbished (Fake)"[0.6, 0.1] ``` --- # Proper System Protection ```mermaid flowchart TD A[Solar Array] --> B{DC Circuit
Breaker} B --> C[DC Disconnect] C --> D{SPD} D --> E[Inverter] E --> F{AC Circuit
Breaker} F --> G[AC Disconnect] G --> H{SPD} H --> I[Main Panel] J[Battery Bank] --> K{Battery
Fuse} K --> L[Battery
Disconnect] L --> E style A fill:#ffeb3b,stroke:#f57f17 style E fill:#c8e6c9,stroke:#388e3c style I fill:#ffe0b2,stroke:#f57c00 style J fill:#b39ddb,stroke:#512da8 style B fill:#ff7043,stroke:#e64a19 style C fill:#ff7043,stroke:#e64a19 style D fill:#ff7043,stroke:#e64a19 style F fill:#ff7043,stroke:#e64a19 style G fill:#ff7043,stroke:#e64a19 style H fill:#ff7043,stroke:#e64a19 style K fill:#ff7043,stroke:#e64a19 style L fill:#ff7043,stroke:#e64a19 ``` --- # Day 2 Hands-On Activities 1. Wiring Workshop - Wire sizing calculation - Proper crimping techniques - MC4 connector assembly - Connection testing 2. Component Examination - Inverter inspection and features - Battery assessment techniques - Protection device identification - Reading specification sheets --- # DAY 3: SYSTEM INTEGRATION & DATASHEET READING ![bg](https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1584276433295-4b59ad5c9622?ixlib=rb-1.2.1&auto=format&fit=crop&w=1350&q=80) --- # Series vs. Parallel Connections ```mermaid flowchart TD subgraph "Series Connection" S1[Panel 1

30V, 9A] --> P4[Result:
30V, 27A] P2[Panel 2
30V, 9A] --> P4 P3[Panel 3
30V, 9A] --> P4 end ``` --- # Component Compatibility Framework ```mermaid mindmap root((Compatibility
Checks)) Panel-to-Inverter Voltage Ranges Current Limits Total Power Inverter-to-Battery Voltage Match Communication Protocol Charging Profiles System Integration Wire Sizing Protection Coordination Monitoring Integration ``` --- # Financial Analysis: Solar vs. Generator ```mermaid timeline title System Cost Analysis Over 10 Years section Initial Investment Year 0 : Solar System: 6M IQD Year 0 : Battery System: 3M IQD section Operational Period Years 1-4 : Minimal Maintenance: 400K IQD Year 5 : Lead-Acid Battery Replacement: 3M IQD section Continued Operation Years 6-9 : Minimal Maintenance: 400K IQD Year 10 : Inverter Replacement: 1.5M IQD ``` --- # Bill of Materials Structure ```mermaid mindmap root((Complete BOM)) Major Components Solar Panels Inverter Batteries Mounting System Rails Clamps Hardware Electrical Components DC Wire AC Wire Connectors Protection Devices Circuit Breakers SPDs Disconnects Documentation System Manual Warranty Papers ``` --- # Day 3 Hands-On Activities 1. System Integration Practice - Component matching exercise - String configuration calculation - Protection device selection - System testing methodology 2. Documentation Development - Create a complete BOM - Research component pricing - Develop customer proposal - Plan installation sequence --- # Days 1-3 Summary and Preview - We've covered system fundamentals, components, and integration - You've practiced load calculation, component selection, and system design - Tomorrow we'll visit an actual installation site - Prepare questions for the installation team - Bring safety equipment for the site visit --- # Questions & Discussion ![bg right:40% 80%](https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1553877522-43269d4ea984?ixlib=rb-1.2.1&auto=format&fit=crop&w=1350&q=80)
